messages.message:
Hey all, I was working with @Sayan and @Xindi Xu, and I think there is a problem with the `ibdev-backend` template where it is not setting `.basrhc` correctly, even though it's configured to do so. I have to look into it, but in the meantime, if you have problems with (a) `node` not running correctly or being the wrong version, or (b) the same for `python`, then please check your `~/.bashrc`. It should have the following content:

```eval "$(/usr/local/pyenv/bin/pyenv init --path)"
eval "$(/usr/local/nodenv/bin/nodenv init -)"

source .bash_profile```
I'll update the thread when I know why the template's version of `.bashrc` isn't applying to new sandboxes.

i created a new sandbox last friday, and strangely this isn't in my `.bashrc` either

but somehow everything worked for me out-of-the-box - maybe bc of the template's snapshot?
It may be due to your personal snapshot @Serena (if you have one)
The template's snapshot bashrc doesn't have those eval lines in it, which are critical
Anyway...I'll try to fix this correctly later in the week. For now, the manual edit of bashrc works to unblock people.
